DataElement.preferredName: Busulfan Overall Drug Exposure Measurement Unit of Measure Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure that represents a determinate amount or quantity of the busulfan overall drug exposure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)_Including everything._Contact with drug._Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04):Including everything.:Contact with drug.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.: The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.: Having reached equilibrium for the measurement or phenomenon concerned.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.

The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.
Having reached equilibrium for the measurement or phenomenon concerned.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Micromole per Liter per Minute Area under Curve

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Micromole per Liter per Minute Area under Curve
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A concentration unit equal to one micromole of solute in one liter of solution per unit of time equal to one minute.: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

Concepts.definition: A concentration unit equal to one micromole of solute in one liter of solution per unit of time equal to one minute.

The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Liter per Milligram per Hour Area under Curve

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Liter per Milligram per Hour Area under Curve
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liters per milligram per hour.: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

Concepts.definition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified used as a standard measurement of same kinds, such as pound or kilogram in measuring weight. (NCI):The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
